document.topic_text: BRIEFS Enegren Brewing toasts 5 years Enegren Brewing Company will celebrate its fifth anniversary with a free, family-friendly beer, food and live music event from 11 a.m. to 8 p.m. Sat., Aug. 20 at the brewery’s facility, 444 Zachary St, Ste. 120, Moorpark. For the first time, the brewery will open the outside parking area for the event, doubling the tasting room size for the day. To commemorate the occasion, Enegren Brewing has teamed up with Nelson’s Green Brier Distillery— both of which are founded by Loyola Marymount alumni— to produce a special Belgian Dark Strong Ale aged in Belle Meade Bourbon barrels. This one-time batch of beer has a rich malty sweetness and plum-like characteristics with notes of bourbon, vanilla, oak and raisin from the bourbon barrels. This brew will be on hand for drinking on site, and available to purchase in bottles to go. Enegren has over eight beers on tap and cask. A special commemorative fifth-anniversary glass will be available for purchase. Food trucks will be available from 11 a.m. to 8 p.m. Live music will run from noon to 8 p.m. A second bar setup will be placed outside with extra tables, chairs and tents outside for additional seating. For more information, go to www.enegrenbrewing.com/anniversary . Sign-ups open for adult sport leagues The City of Moorpark offers adult recreational basketball and softball leagues for the fall. Players of all ability levels are encouraged to sign up. Registration runs through Sept. 2 for all leagues. Space is limited and is on a first-come, first-served basis. The leagues are: Monday or Thursday basketball, Friday night coed softball and Thursday night men’s softball with upper and lower divisions available. Registration packets are available at www.moorparkca.gov or pick one up at the Arroyo Vista Recreation Center. Kids basketball tips off this fall The fall Moorpark Youth Basketball League is open to children ages 5 to 13. All players, both returning and new, must attend registration at the Arroyo Vista Recreation Center on the dates listed below. Families should attend the date designated for the child’s age on the date of registration. All sign-up sessions will run from 4 to 6 p.m. Rookie Division, ages 5 to 7: Tues., Aug. 30. Junior Division, ages 8 to 10: Wed., Aug. 31. Teen Division, ages 11 to 13: Thurs., Sept. 1. The eight-week season runs Jan. 9 through Feb. 27. Weekly practices and games are held at the Arroyo Vista Recreation Center, 4550 Tierra Rejada Road. Volunteer coaches are needed. Registration fees are $79 for the Rookie Division and $89 for both the Junior and Teen divisions. Fees include a jersey, trophy, team photo and end-of-season pizza party. For details, call (805) 517-6300 or visit www.moorparkca.gov .
